title: Accept negative `Level::Precise`

labels.name: A-semver-major
labels.description: breaking change requiring a major version bump

body:
Fixed #179

Also, for bzip2, flate2 and zstd, use min/max level provided by the crate instead of hard-code these values into async-compression.

Signed-off-by: Jiahao XU <Jiahao_XU@outlook.com>

title: Migrate from bors to merge queues
body: Also needs reconfiguring in the settings, I'll do that if you want to use merge queues, the main upside is that it skips the slow exhaustive job before showing PR status, and that job is unlikely to be broken with most changes. Otherwise I could just update that job to run on pull-request too and have a normal one-click-merge.

labels.name: A-semver-norelease
labels.description: change that does not require a release

title: chore: update locked vulnerable deps
body: does the minimal amount to fix the `cargo deny advisories` CI job

title: Remove support for tokio 0.2 and 0.3

labels.name: A-semver-major
labels.description: breaking change requiring a major version bump

body:
I have checked the index using `rg -IN 'async-compression' | jq -r '"\(.name) \(.vers): \(.deps[] | select(.name == "async-compression") | .features | join(", "))"'` and there are only 2 crates that have their latest version still using `tokio-02` and no crates using `tokio-03`.

I wanted to wait for `std` to introduce some async IO traits and go directly to 1.0 when removing this support, but given how long it has been and how far away that still appears to be, I think it's time to do this now. This will simplify exposing more of the internals in order to allow some of the usecases people want (#133, #150).

title: Add ZstdEncoder::with_quality_and_params to enable compression parameters
body: This allows enabling parameters such as long-distance matching mode or rsyncable mode.
